intro: Clidemia strigilliflora, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Clidemia strigilliflora is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a potential invasive species in certain regions.
